verses.kjv: Let a man so account of us, as of the ministers of Christ, and stewards of the mysteries of God.
verses.web: So let a man think of us as Christ’s servants, and stewards of God’s mysteries.
verses.ct: Think of us this way: we are servants of Christ and people entrusted with the mysteries of God.

verses.kjv: Moreover it is required in stewards, that a man be found faithful.
verses.web: Here, moreover, it is required of stewards that they be found faithful.
verses.ct: Now, the one thing required of someone given that kind of trust is that they prove faithful.

verses.kjv: But with me it is a very small thing that I should be judged of you, or of man’s judgment: yea, I judge not mine own self.
verses.web: But with me it is a very small thing that I should be judged by you, or by man’s judgment. Yes, I don’t judge my own self.
verses.ct: Honestly, it matters very little to me whether you judge me or whether any human court does. I don't even judge myself.

verses.kjv: For I know nothing by myself; yet am I not hereby justified: but he that judgeth me is the Lord.
verses.web: For I know nothing against myself. Yet I am not justified by this, but he who judges me is the Lord.
verses.ct: My conscience is clear, but that doesn't prove I'm in the right. The Lord is the one who judges me.

verses.kjv: Therefore judge nothing before the time, until the Lord come, who both will bring to light the hidden things of darkness, and will make manifest the counsels of the hearts: and then shall every man have praise of God.
verses.web: Therefore judge nothing before the time, until the Lord comes, who will both bring to light the hidden things of darkness, and reveal the counsels of the hearts. Then each man will get his praise from God.
verses.ct: So don't pass judgment on anyone before the right time. Wait until the Lord comes. He will expose what's hidden in the darkness and reveal the true motives of every heart. Then each person will receive whatever praise they deserve from God.

verses.kjv: And these things, brethren, I have in a figure transferred to myself and to Apollos for your sakes; that ye might learn in us not to think of men above that which is written, that no one of you be puffed up for one against another.
verses.web: Now these things, brothers, I have in a figure transferred to myself and Apollos for your sakes, that in us you might learn not to think beyond the things which are written, that none of you be puffed up against one another.
verses.ct: Brothers, I've applied all of this to myself and Apollos as examples for your benefit. The point is that you learn from us not to go beyond what Scripture says, so that none of you become arrogant by picking one leader over another.

verses.kjv: For who maketh thee to differ from another? and what hast thou that thou didst not receive? now if thou didst receive it, why dost thou glory, as if thou hadst not received it?
verses.web: For who makes you different? And what do you have that you didn’t receive? But if you did receive it, why do you boast as if you had not received it?
verses.ct: Who says you're better than anyone else? What do you have that wasn't given to you? And if it was given to you, why do you brag as if you earned it yourself?

verses.kjv: Now ye are full, now ye are rich, ye have reigned as kings without us: and I would to God ye did reign, that we also might reign with you.
verses.web: You are already filled. You have already become rich. You have come to reign without us. Yes, and I wish that you did reign, that we also might reign with you.
verses.ct: Oh, you already have everything you need! You're already rich! You've already become kings — and without us! I actually wish you really were reigning, so we could reign alongside you.

verses.kjv: For I think that God hath set forth us the apostles last, as it were appointed to death: for we are made a spectacle unto the world, and to angels, and to men.
verses.web: For, I think that God has displayed us, the apostles, last of all, like men sentenced to death. For we are made a spectacle to the world, both to angels and men.
verses.ct: Instead, it seems like God has put us apostles on display at the very end of the parade, like prisoners sentenced to die. We've become a spectacle for the whole world to watch — both angels and people.

verses.kjv: We are fools for Christ’s sake, but ye are wise in Christ; we are weak, but ye are strong; ye are honourable, but we are despised.
verses.web: We are fools for Christ’s sake, but you are wise in Christ. We are weak, but you are strong. You have honor, but we have dishonor.
verses.ct: We are fools for Christ's sake, but you are so wise in Christ. We are weak, but you are strong. You are honored, but we are looked down on.

verses.kjv: Even unto this present hour we both hunger, and thirst, and are naked, and are buffeted, and have no certain dwellingplace;
verses.web: Even to this present hour we hunger, thirst, are naked, are beaten, and have no certain dwelling place.
verses.ct: Right up to this very moment, we go hungry and thirsty. We're poorly clothed, roughly treated, and have no permanent home.

verses.kjv: And labour, working with our own hands: being reviled, we bless; being persecuted, we suffer it:
verses.web: We toil, working with our own hands. When people curse us, we bless. Being persecuted, we endure.
verses.ct: We work hard with our own hands to support ourselves. When people curse us, we bless them. When we're persecuted, we endure it.

verses.kjv: Being defamed, we intreat: we are made as the filth of the world, and are the offscouring of all things unto this day.
verses.web: Being defamed, we entreat. We are made as the filth of the world, the dirt wiped off by all, even until now.
verses.ct: When we're slandered, we respond with kindness. To this day, we're treated like the world's garbage — the scum everyone scrapes off and throws away.

verses.kjv: I write not these things to shame you, but as my beloved sons I warn you.
verses.web: I don’t write these things to shame you, but to admonish you as my beloved children.
verses.ct: I'm not writing this to embarrass you. I'm warning you because you are my dear children.

verses.kjv: For though ye have ten thousand instructors in Christ, yet have ye not many fathers: for in Christ Jesus I have begotten you through the gospel.
verses.web: For though you have ten thousand tutors in Christ, you don’t have many fathers. For in Christ Jesus, I became your father through the Good News.
verses.ct: Even if you had 10,000 tutors in Christ, you don't have many fathers. I became your father in Christ Jesus when I brought you the gospel.

verses.kjv: Wherefore I beseech you, be ye followers of me.
verses.web: I beg you therefore, be imitators of me.
verses.ct: So I urge you: follow my example.

verses.kjv: For this cause have I sent unto you Timotheus, who is my beloved son, and faithful in the Lord, who shall bring you into remembrance of my ways which be in Christ, as I teach every where in every church.
verses.web: Because of this I have sent Timothy to you, who is my beloved and faithful child in the Lord, who will remind you of my ways which are in Christ, even as I teach everywhere in every assembly.
verses.ct: That's exactly why I'm sending Timothy to you. He is my dear and faithful son in the Lord. He'll remind you of how I live in Christ — the same way I teach in every church everywhere.

verses.kjv: Now some are puffed up, as though I would not come to you.
verses.web: Now some are puffed up, as though I were not coming to you.
verses.ct: Some of you have gotten arrogant, acting as if I'm never going to show up.

verses.kjv: But I will come to you shortly, if the Lord will, and will know, not the speech of them which are puffed up, but the power.
verses.web: But I will come to you shortly, if the Lord is willing. And I will know, not the word of those who are puffed up, but the power.
verses.ct: But I will come to you soon, if the Lord is willing. And when I do, I won't be interested in the big talk of these arrogant people — I'll be looking for real power.

verses.kjv: For the kingdom of God is not in word, but in power.
verses.web: For God’s Kingdom is not in word, but in power.
verses.ct: Because the kingdom of God isn't about impressive words. It's about power.

verses.kjv: What will ye? shall I come unto you with a rod, or in love, and in the spirit of meekness?
verses.web: What do you want? Shall I come to you with a rod, or in love and a spirit of gentleness?
verses.ct: So what's it going to be? Do you want me to come with a rod of discipline, or with love and a spirit of gentleness?
